intro: Galium spurium f. vaillantii, commonly known as the Vaillant's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is native to Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodland edges and stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in gardens and conservation areas.
